intro: Koanophyllon mimicum, commonly known as the mimic dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers consist of a yellow disk surrounded by white ray florets, resembling a dandelion. Koanophyllon mimicum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
